titles.title: Congratulating the people of Mongolia on the 5th anniversary of the first democratic multiparty elections held in Mongolia on July 29, 1990.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. Bereuter moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 9/18/1995--Passed House amended. Commends Mongolia for its efforts toward transformation to a multiparty state and a free market economy. Urges the Government of Mongolia to continue to strengthen and deepen democratic reform and human rights, including the full protection of religious freedom and other civil liberties. Pledges continued support for democracy, human rights, and the development of a free market in Mongolia.
